metadata.job_to_be_done: Create and manage fillable forms for onboarding and compliance.

extracted_sections.section_title: Change flat forms to fillable Acrobat Pro

subsection_analysis.refined_text: Not all forms are fillable. Sometimes form creators dont convert their PDFs to interactive fillable forms. Or, they intentionally design a form that you can fill in only by hand or with the Fill  Sign tool. These non-interactive forms are called flat forms.
To create an interactive form, use the Prepare Forms tool. See Create a form from an existing document .

An interactive form contains fields that you can select or fill in. Select anywhere in the form to access options, such as radio buttons. When finished, submit the form to either send the data to a server or create an email to send the data. For example, the Hand tool changes to an I-beam when you can type text into the form field. Some text fields are dynamic, meaning that they automatically resize to accommodate the amount of data you enter and can span across pages.

Interactive forms : These contain fields that you can select and fill in. You can complete the forms by entering information and adding your signatures. Flat forms : These do not have interactive fields. It could be a paper form or PDF that hasnt been optimized for form filling. Acrobat also allows you to send your completed forms to others and securely save them in Adobe cloud storage.

Acrobat and Acrobat Reader users can use the Fill  Sign tool to fill in flat forms. You can change a flat form to a fillable form by either using the Prepare Form tool or enabling the Fill  Sign tools.
